meanings.sent1: The store had a variety of merchandizes on display.
meanings.sent2: I bought some new merchandizes for my home.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the merchandizes, creating a mess.

meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors showcasing their merchandizes.

meanings.sent1: She merchandizes her handmade jewelry at local craft fairs.
meanings.sent2: The company hired a team to merchandize their new product.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to merchandize his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: His persuasive skills can merchandize anything to anyone.
meanings.sent5: The salesman knew how to merchandize the latest gadgets effectively.

meanings.definition: The act of buying and selling goods.
meanings.sent1: The market was busy with the merchandizes of vendors.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the thrill of merchandizes at the auction.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best merchandizes was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Their partnership led to successful merchandizes in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The history of trade is filled with stories of merchandizes and exchanges.
